intro: Micropholis schwackei, commonly known as the African ebony, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal forests and riverine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and timber quality, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
